title: fare sesso con la sorella
author: fare sesso con la sorella
content: A friend told me that the bitcointalk forum is almost like a proper classroom for learning bitcoin..I want to learn bitcoin in this forum.can you guide me with some guide?

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Congratulations on finding you way here to Bitcointallk forum, it’s just the first step to many great step ahead in achieving your goals. My first guide to you is to always make constructive post. Post like the one you just made is shallow and lacks real content. Regardless I would advice you to read these very important post and not just only should you read it, try to digest it.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=178608.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: BIT-BENDER on May 27, 2022, 08:56:42 PMCongratulations on finding you way here to Bitcointallk forum, it’s just the first step to many great step ahead in achieving your goals. <cut>As you can tell by his nickname, I'm not convinced his goals on bitcointalk are exactly noble. But hey, to each his own. However, I'm afraid this one goes directly to my ignore list.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk forum. First thing to do is to familiarize the forum itself like the forum rules and what's best to do to be able to contribute in the forum in any way you can. You can stay here anytime you want to learn about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency related topics. This forum will help you learn much faster as your can ask whatever you have difficulty of understanding. Don't let the criticism affect you as it will only help point out your mistakes. Good luck.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: * If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chaptersBitcointalk is more of just a place where you can ask questions, not necessarily a "proper classroom" imo.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: fare sesso con la sorella on May 27, 2022, 06:15:22 PMA friend told me that the bitcointalk forum is almost like a proper classroom for learning bitcoin..I want to learn bitcoin in this forum.can you guide me with some guide?Yes it is. Its sound so easy but yes, you need to learn a lot of things about bitcoin here since this is the place where all it started.Just checked out the links of above people sent. But if you want you could always find a particular topic you are interested here by using the search function. All topics that you want will pop out.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on May 27, 2022, 09:25:09 PMQuote from: BIT-BENDER on May 27, 2022, 08:56:42 PMCongratulations on finding you way here to Bitcointallk forum, it’s just the first step to many great step ahead in achieving your goals. <cut>As you can tell by his nickname, I'm not convinced his goals on bitcointalk are exactly noble. But hey, to each his own. However, I'm afraid this one goes directly to my ignore list.That's exactly what I thought when I saw his nickname. I don't think the OP is interested in learning about cryptocurrencies, he's being too frank about his preferences. At least, it causes rejection from the first moment.OP, do you need cryptocurrency to avoid asking your mom for money to visit a porn site?

comments.author: worle1bm
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on May 27, 2022, 09:25:09 PMQuote from: BIT-BENDER on May 27, 2022, 08:56:42 PMCongratulations on finding you way here to Bitcointallk forum, it’s just the first step to many great step ahead in achieving your goals. <cut>As you can tell by his nickname, I'm not convinced his goals on bitcointalk are exactly noble. But hey, to each his own. However, I'm afraid this one goes directly to my ignore list.I was not aware about this name and after you post just translated it and got to know why you were saying this and this clearly states someone's intentions.You can choose a decent username if you want to have real knowledge experience on the forum but taking their name is not a good idea at all.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on May 27, 2022, 09:25:09 PMAs you can tell by his nickname, I'm not convinced his goals on bitcointalk are exactly noble. But hey, to each his own. However, I'm afraid this one goes directly to my ignore list.I had to quickly use my device to translate the name, and it's quite an odd choice of a username.I would not however hold it against the user as much; On registering; many users are not familiar with the permanency of their username and consider this to be just another social hangout where you can act on all your whims. Nothing wrong in anyone on those assumptions, except if the user does not actually try to read and understand how the forum works and how it's different from regular social platforms.If in a couple of months OP applies for change of display name to the admin, they have my support.Or they could just never log in again, like many newbies who have popped up.

comments.author: Israelgogo
comments.body: Coming to this platform and being in this forum is an opportunity to contribute, comment and share my opinion important matters or relevant topics that needs serious discussions, it give me opportunity to learn from others from different part of the world on relevant discussions,tho there are meeting people whose aim is to discourage your effort here ,it thought me to over look and give blind eye on their opinion,everyone wasnt created with same reasoning,some are failures and they push the anger on others. Mine is to overlook and accept only relevant corrections, objection,consideration, contribution and work on them ,while i ignore the criticism and see the positive side of the discussions. I have meet very beautiful and nice kind hearted people in here whom i see as my mentors in content write up ,i am learning here everyday  .To all whom will find fault in this statement ,it just my candid opinion.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on May 28, 2022, 05:10:37 AMThat's exactly what I thought when I saw his nickname. I don't think the OP is interested in learning about cryptocurrencies, he's being too frank about his preferences. At least, it causes rejection from the first moment.OP, do you need cryptocurrency to avoid asking your mom for money to visit a porn site?Lolx... it is possible that OP is not an adult. You cannot imagine some weird things children can do. I said so because some people aren't always frank about their preferences, especially when such preferences are not upheld as morally right by the society. I know that the preference of some users here is to scam. But I haven't seen someone with the username as "I am a scammer".Again, I align with Upgrade00 as he said that many users are not aware of the permanency of usernames here. I know that if OP understands the real importance of this space, he/she will surely come back with a variant account.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: I'm curious what's on his nickname, so I Googled it and translate, omg! it's parental guidance. I didn't understand it at the first glance because ain't Italian but how did OP choose this nickname which is even anywhere on the platforms, this shouldn't be accepted. We didn't know what is the real purpose of choosing this nickname by the OP, either he didn't know or just seeking attention to the forum.  Though whatever it is, there is no rule for choosing a nickname, not at least for the purpose of scamming, spamming, or any violation that's against the forum's rule.  I suggest reading more first before posting it here and be careful on choosing a nickname

comments.author: BobK71
comments.body: Welcome to this forum and what you have heard from your friend is also true. This forum is able to give you all kinds of assistance in the crypto world. Since you are new, you need to spend a little more time here initially. You have to read a lot to know more and if you mention any specific problem or you don't understand, I think you will get the answer as early as possible.

comments.author: Munir575
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on May 27, 2022, 09:25:09 PMQuote from: BIT-BENDER on May 27, 2022, 08:56:42 PMCongratulations on finding you way here to Bitcointallk forum, it’s just the first step to many great step ahead in achieving your goals. <cut>As you can tell by his nickname, I'm not convinced his goals on bitcointalk are exactly noble. But hey, to each his own. However, I'm afraid this one goes directly to my ignore list. Don't judge a book by its cover. Everyone is welcome here irrespective of their goals. Its just a name lets give him all the help we can.

comments.author: fare sesso con la sorella
comments.body: Quote from: Munir575 on May 29, 2022, 12:18:53 PMQuote from: FatFork on May 27, 2022, 09:25:09 PMQuote from: BIT-BENDER on May 27, 2022, 08:56:42 PMCongratulations on finding you way here to Bitcointallk forum, it’s just the first step to many great step ahead in achieving your goals. <cut>As you can tell by his nickname, I'm not convinced his goals on bitcointalk are exactly noble. But hey, to each his own. However, I'm afraid this one goes directly to my ignore list. Don't judge a book by its cover. Everyone is welcome here irrespective of their goals. Its just a name lets give him all the help we can. No my friend needed.. because I feel like I have been harassed here just because of my name..,, I don't know if name  problematic in here..., may god bless you all..

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: fare sesso con la sorella on May 29, 2022, 03:14:07 PM<snip>No my friend needed.. because I feel like I have been harassed here just because of my name..,, I don't know if name  problematic in here..., may god bless you all..As far as I know there are no rules about name here. But if you want to be a decent person here, in my opinion, you should use an appropriate username. For my years of being here, you're the only one that I saw which has that kind of username. I'm quite amazed that you did not expect bein criticized because of the name choice of yours. To me, your username seems like trolling which belongs to a troll.Regardless, welcome to the forum

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: fare sesso con la sorella on May 29, 2022, 03:14:07 PMNo my friend needed.. because I feel like I have been harassed here just because of my name..,, I don't know if name  problematic in here..., may god bless you all..What do you mean, you feel harassed here? Did you expect people to take you seriously? You chose a username that implies desire for sex with your sister? (I had to use Google Translate, so correct me if I am wrong.) Have you ever wondered how we (other forum members) might feel when we see this?So, fuck off, juvenile troll! You have no idea what harassment means.

comments.author: Queentoshi
comments.body: Quote from: fare sesso con la sorella on May 27, 2022, 06:15:22 PMA friend told me that the bitcointalk forum is almost like a proper classroom for learning bitcoin..I want to learn bitcoin in this forum.can you guide me with some guide?Hello and welcome here, you have a good friend who has pointed you in the right direction and just like others, you should take this forum seriously as identification with a community like this that centers mostly around your interest is a good way to learn faster. I've not been so long here, but going through some topics I have seen here tells me that I'm in the right place for knowledge and learning, likewise you.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Welcome to the bitcointalk forum. Your motive here is clear and understanding. What you need to do is to follow the rules guiding the forum. Always ask questions where you’re lost and most importantly (DYOR) do your own research. It will avoid you been mislead as you never know the true motive of others. Not to scare you though, you’re in the right place to learn. Do make sure you go through the pinned message on the Beginners and help section it’ll give you more understanding of the forum as a newbie.

comments.author: Maestro75
comments.body: Quote from: fare sesso con la sorella on May 27, 2022, 06:15:22 PMA friend told me that the bitcointalk forum is almost like a proper classroom for learning bitcoin..I want to learn bitcoin in this forum.can you guide me with some guide?Nice to meet you too. To learn here, my advice to you is that you have to watch others and stay quiet alot of time while reading posts from other members. Also, you have to respect elders and forum rules. Do not be toxic. Did your friend not also tell you about bounties? Sure he did. Here is a good place for cryptocurrency experience and learning. But you have to show determination to succeed by yourself and work towards it.
